Who is Alex Pereira, and What is the UFC?

Alex Pereira is a professional mixed martial artist and former kickboxer from Brazil. He is currently the champion of the light heavyweight division in the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC), which is the premier organization in mixed martial arts (MMA). Known for his devastating striking ability and knockout power, Pereira has an MMA record of 12 wins, 2 losses, and no draws (12-2-0), with 10 of his victories coming by knockout. Before transitioning to MMA, Pereira achieved remarkable success in the Glory kickboxing organization, where he made history as the only fighter to be a simultaneous two-division champion.

A Captivating Rivalry

Before their iconic UFC rivalry, Pereira and Adesanya clashed in the electrifying world of kickboxing. Their 2016 and 2017 bouts were a testament to their exceptional skills and unwavering determination. While Pereira emerged victorious on both occasions, the fights were a closely contested battle that ignited a fierce rivalry. This early encounter laid the foundation for the intense and captivating clashes that would later unfold in the UFC octagon. These early battles between Pereira and Adesanya in the kickboxing ring served as a crucial chapter in their careers. These intense confrontations not only showcased their exceptional fighting abilities but also highlighted their contrasting styles. Pereira’s raw power and aggressive approach were met by Adesanya’s technical precision and tactical brilliance. These early clashes laid the groundwork for their subsequent epic battles in the UFC, where their rivalry would reach new heights and captivate the world.
